Eat and drink more when you have a fever according to scientists.

hl.seg: First nuclear test was done in 1990.

doc.seg: Thomas Reid, who worked in the Leur National Laboratory as a weapon designer wrote this book with the help of Los Alamos National Laboratory's former Technical Intelligence Director, Danny Staleman.

In this book, called 'Nuclear Express', details the political history of the bomb and its spread. Both the authors claim that whichever country made an atom bomb, they either stole the nuclear secrets from another country or they got help from a nuclear power.
Thomas Reid said in an interview with US News that China tested Pakistan's first atom bomb in 1990. This was during the term of the Prime Minister Benazir Bhutto.
Thomas Reid said that, due to many factors, he is certain that China tested Pakistan's first nuclear bomb.
Among the factors are the design of the bomb and the information he gathered from Chinese scientists.
He further added this was the reason that Pakistan was able to respond to India's Nuclear test with a nuclear test in just 2 weeks and 3 days.
Thomas Reid reminded us that in 1961 Russia suddenly performed a nuclear test. The response to which America took 17 days to preform a test. This was despite having this bomb for a long time.
He added that the atom bomb that was tested on May 19th 1998 by Pakistan was made very carefully, and that Pakistani scientists had complete faith in it.
When Thomas Reid was asked whether China had provided nuclear technology to Pakistan, he said India was the common enemy of both China and Pakistan.
He said that there was proof available that Dr. Abdul Qadeer Khan used the Chinese design. Later, documents were received from Libya which also verified this fact.
When asked whether joint nuclear testing was common, he said that America had openly performed nuclear tests for England in the deserts of Nevada in 1990.
He said that he also believes that Israel has access to the results of this testing.
Thomas Reid was also asked about China's nuclear distribution program which is ongoing.
In answer, Thomas Reid said that China has been providing raw material, guidance and design for the nuclear setup in Esfahan, Iran since 1991.
In conjunction with this, China provided Iran with the nuclear enrichment plant in Kheraj.
He said that China has been providing Iran, Syria, Pakistan, Egypt, and Libya with nuclear technology through North Korea.

hl.seg: Tea: A potential cure for breast cancer?

reduced their chances of breast cancer by 37 percent among those who drank three cups of tea a day.
The research indicated that older women did not get any benefit from drinking three or more cups of tea a day.
The researchers think that the tea contains polyphenols that are effective against the type of oncogene in the breast cancer that affects women younger than 50.
In Moffitt Cancer Center, in the city of Tampa, Florida state, a research was conducted on over 5000 women, who had undergone treatment for breast cancer.
Their ages were between 20 and 74 years.
Experts compared their medical records and lifestyles with women who were safe from breast cancer.
The experts also found out that on a specific type of cancer called lobular cancer, the drinking of tea has shown clear effects, and has decreased its occurrence by 66 percent.
A tenth of every breast cancer patient suffers this type of cancer.
This type of cancer is more dangerous because it is deeper and is usually only known after it spreads quite a bit.
Experts say that regular tea consumption, at least three cups a day, can drastically reduce the occurrence of breast cancer in young women.
They say that making tea a regular beverage taken on a daily basis and included in ones daily activities causes the suitable defense required against cancer in the body.
In Britain, every year, approximately 40,000 women are diagnosed with breast cancer.
